page.title: 02The History Of Poole Harbour
page.content: This is the second largest natural harbour in the world. In the war the harbour was used by flying boats to ship troops to the fighting countries and Winston Churchill visited the harbour to see the first flying boat take off. In the Second World War a runway was built so that Sunderland Bombers could be stationed at the harbour. The standard of the beach varied according to the opinions of different people. Some people thought that the sand is fine and clear and free of pebbles, stones and other dirty material while others think it is tourists who are to blame for the litter problem. We saw many sea sports in the harbour: sailing, windsurfing, speedboat racing and water_skiing. {**cont.page 3**
